definition[0]: to make a place tidy by removing things from it and getting rid of them
example[0]: I need to clear out my closet.
definition[1]: to leave a place or building quickly
note[0]: clear out! British English (=used to tell someone angrily to go away)
example[1]: Wait to get on the train until the people getting off have cleared out.
definition[2]: a process in which you get rid of unwanted objects or possessions
example[2]: I had a clear-out and got rid of a lot of old toys.
definition[3]: to sell goods cheaply in order to get rid of them
example[3]: Ford is offering discounts in order to clear out last yearâ€™s models.
